channel.title: Codefresh CLI Documentation
channel.description: Recent content on Codefresh CLI Documentation

item.title: Create Pipeline Trigger
Config
item.description: Config context stores a set of keys and values. Type .spec.type should be config. Data .spec.data should be an array of keys and values. Examples config with two keys apiVersion: "v1" kind: "context" owner: "account" metadata: name: "my-config-context" spec: type: "config" data: dbUrl: "db-url" sysUrl: "sys-url"

item.title: NPM
Config
item.description: Description Create a config context. Command codefresh create context config <name> Arguments Option Alias Default Description name Name of context Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –owner account Owner of the context Possible values: - user - account –variable - v Variables list Examples Create a config.

item.title: Delete Helm Release
item.description: Description Delete a helm release from a kubernetes cluster. Command codefresh delete-release [name] Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –cluster Run on cluster. required –timeout 300 time in seconds to wait for any individual kubernetes operation (like Jobs for hooks) (default 300) –purge remove the release from the store and make its name free for later use (default true) –detach - d Run pipeline and print build ID –no-hooks prevent hooks from running during deletion Examples Delete release “my-release” from cluster “my-cluster” codefresh delete-release my-release --cluster my-cluster

item.title: Get
item.description: Description Get a resource from a file, directory or url Supported resources:. Command codefresh get Output Options Option Alias Default Description –output - o Output format Possible values: - json - yaml - wide - name - id –watch - w Watching updates to a particular resource –watch-interval 3 Interval time at watching mode (in seconds) Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –filename - f Filename or directory of spec files use to create the resource

item.title: Get Build
item.description: Description Get a specific build or an array of builds. Passing [id] argument will cause a retrieval of a specific build. In case of not passing [id] argument, a list will be returned. Command codefresh get builds [id..] Aliases codefresh get build [id..] Arguments Option Alias Default Description id Build id Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –limit 25 Limit amount of returned results –page 1 Paginated page –status Filter results by statuses

item.title: Get Composition
item.description: Description Get a specific composition or an array of compositions. Passing [id|name] argument will cause a retrieval of a specific composition. In case of not passing [id|name] argument, a list will be returned. Command codefresh get compositions [id|name..] Aliases codefresh get com [id|name..] codefresh get composition [id|name..] Arguments Option Alias Default Description id composition id or name Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information Output Options Option Alias Default Description –output - o Output format

item.title: Get Context
item.description: Description Get a specific context or an array of contexts. Passing [name] argument will cause a retrieval of a specific context. In case of not passing [name] argument, a list will be returned. Command codefresh get contexts [name..] Aliases codefresh get ctx [name..] codefresh get context [name..] Arguments Option Alias Default Description name context name Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –type Context type

item.title: Get Contexts
item.description: Description Get all possible authentication contexts. Command codefresh auth get-contexts Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information Examples List all existing authentication contexts codefresh auth get-contexts

item.title: Get Environment
item.description: Description Get a specific environment or an array of environments. Passing [id] argument will cause a retrieval of a specific environment. In case of not passing [id] argument, a list will be returned. Command codefresh get environments [id..] Aliases codefresh get env [id..] codefresh get environment [id..] Arguments Option Alias Default Description id environment id or name Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information Output Options Option Alias Default Description –output - o Output format

item.title: Get Image
item.description: Description Get a specific image or an array of images. Passing [id] argument will cause a retrieval of a specific image. In case of not passing [id] argument, a list will be returned. Command codefresh get images [id..] Aliases codefresh get img [id..] codefresh get image [id..] Arguments Option Alias Default Description id Docker Image id Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –limit 25 Limit amount of returned results –all - a Return images from all possible registries (by default only r.

item.title: Get Pipeline
item.description: Description Get a specific pipeline or an array of pipelines. Command codefresh get pipelines-v2 [name..] Aliases codefresh get pip-v2 [name..] codefresh get pipeline-v2 [name..] Arguments Option Alias Default Description name Pipeline name Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –name-regex Filter pipelines by name –label - l Filter by a label –limit 25 Limit amount of returned results –page 1 Paginated page Output Options Option Alias Default Description –output - o Output format

item.title: Get Pipeline
item.description: Description Get a specific pipeline or an array of pipelines. Passing [id] argument will cause a retrieval of a specific pipeline. In case of not passing [id] argument, a list will be returned. Command codefresh get pipelines [id..] Aliases codefresh get pip [id..] codefresh get pipeline [id..] Arguments Option Alias Default Description id Pipeline id Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –repo-owner Repository owner –repo-name Repository name –limit 25 Limit amount of returned results –page 1 Paginated page –name Filter results by pipeline name Output Options Option Alias Default Description –output - o Output format

item.title: Get Trigger Event
item.description: Description Get trigger-event. Command codefresh get trigger-events [event-uri] Aliases codefresh get trigger-event [event-uri] Arguments Option Alias Default Description event-uri trigger-event URI) Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –type trigger-event type –kind trigger-event kind –filter trigger-event URI filter (regex) –public true get public trigger-event(s) Output Options Option Alias Default Description –output - o Output format

item.title: Get Trigger Types
item.description: Description Get a list of available trigger-types. Command codefresh get trigger-types Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –type filter by a specific trigger type (e.g. registry, cron) –kind filter by a specific trigger kind (e.g. dockerhub, cfcr, gcr, acr); only some trigger-types may have kinds Output Options Option Alias Default Description –output - o Output format

item.title: Get Triggers
item.description: Description Get triggers, optionally filtered by pipeline or event. Command codefresh get trigger Aliases codefresh get t trigger Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –pipeline pipeline id –event-uri event URI Output Options Option Alias Default Description –output - o Output format

item.title: HTTP
item.description:
Description Create a helm-repository context from HTTP server.
A chart repository is an HTTP server that houses an index.yaml file and optionally some packaged charts. When you’re ready to share your charts, the preferred way to do so is by uploading them to a chart repository. Read more: https://github.com/kubernetes/helm/blob/master/docs/chart_repository.md. Command codefresh create context helm-repository http <name> Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –url Url to the web server.

item.title: Secret
item.description: Secret context stores a set of keys and values encrypted. Type .spec.type should be secret. Data .spec.data should be an array of keys and values. Examples secret with two keys apiVersion: "v1" kind: "context" owner: "account" metadata: name: "my-secret-context" spec: type: "secret" data: dbPassword: "secret-db-password" adminPassword: "secret-admin-password"

item.title: YARN
Create
item.description: Description Create a resource from a file, directory or url Supported resources: ‘context’ ‘pipeline-v2’. Command codefresh create Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –filename - f Filename or directory of spec files use to create the resource

item.title: Create Composition
Create Context
item.description: Description Create or update an authentication context. Creating authentication contexts enables the ability to work against multiple accounts. Command codefresh auth create-context [name] Arguments Option Alias Default Description name default Context name Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –url https://g.codefresh.io Codefresh system custom url –api-key API key.

item.title: Create Trigger Event
item.description: Description Create new trigger-event. Command codefresh create trigger-event Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –type trigger-event type –kind trigger-event kind –public wether trigger-event is public (system-wide): can be linked to any pipeline in any account –secret !generate trigger-event secret (omit to auto-generate) –value trigger-event specific values pairs (key=value), as required by trigger-type –context context with credentials required to setup event on remote system Examples Create registry/dockerhub trigger-event codefresh create trigger-event --type registry --kind dockerhub --value namespace=codefresh --value name=fortune --value action=push

item.title: Delete Pipeline Trigger
Install or Upgrade Helm Chart
item.description: Description Install or upgrade a Helm chart Repository flag can be either absolute url or saved repository in Codefresh. Command codefresh install-chart Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –cluster Install on cluster. required –namespace default Install on namespace –tiller-namespace kube-system Where tiller has been installed –repository https://kubernetes-charts.

item.title: S3
item.description:
Description Create a helm-repository context from s3 bucket.
Helm repository can be stored in AWS S3 bucket. Codefresh will integrate with the bucket in the following order If environment variables AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY ,AWS_DEFAULT_REGION are set, will use it to create context. You can override them using flags aws-access-key-id aws-secret-access-key aws-default-region. Command codefresh create context helm-repository s3 <name> Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –aws-access-key-id Amazon access key id.

item.title: Secret
item.description: Description Create a secret context. Command codefresh create context secret <name> Arguments Option Alias Default Description name Name of context Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –owner account Owner of the context Possible values: - user - account –variable - v Variables list Examples Create a secret.

item.title: Show Build Logs
Docker Image
Yaml
item.description: Yaml context stores an yaml file. Type .spec.type should be yaml. Data .spec.data should be an array of keys and values. Examples yaml with two keys apiVersion: "v1" kind: "context" owner: "account" metadata: name: "my-yaml-context" spec: type: "yaml" data: serviceType: "LoadBalancer" image: "mongo"

item.title: Delete
item.description: Description Delete a resource from a file, directory or url Supported resources: ‘Context’ ‘Pipeline-v2’. Command codefresh delete Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –filename - f Filename or directory of spec files use to create the resource

item.title: Delete Composition
Delete Context
item.description: Description Delete a context. Command codefresh delete context [name] Aliases codefresh delete ctx [name] Arguments Option Alias Default Description name Name of context Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information Examples Delete context NAME codefresh delete context NAME

item.title: Delete Environment
Delete Pipeline
item.description: Description Delete a pipeline. Command codefresh delete pipeline-v2 [name] Aliases codefresh delete pip-v2 [name] Arguments Option Alias Default Description name Pipeline name Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information

item.title: Delete Trigger Event
Get Activated Context
item.description: Description Get the current activated authentication context. Command codefresh auth current-context Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information Examples Show active authentication context codefresh auth current-context

item.title: Restart Build
Secret Yaml
item.description: Description Create a secret-yaml context. Command codefresh create context secret-yaml <name> Arguments Option Alias Default Description name Name of context Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –owner account Owner of the context Possible values: - user - account –variable - v Variables list

item.title: Test Helm Release
item.description: Description Test a helm release. Command codefresh test-release [name] Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –cluster Run on cluster. required –timeout 300 time in seconds to wait for any individual kubernetes operation (like Jobs for hooks) (default 300) –detach - d Run pipeline and print build ID –cleanup false delete test pods upon completion (default false)

item.title: Download
item.description: Navigate to Official Releases and download the binary that matches your operating system. We currently support the following OS: Linux-x64 Macos-x64 Windows-x64 After downloading the binary, untar or unzip it and your are good to go. You can also add the binary to your system PATH environment variable so you can use it easily. If your operating system is missing please feel free to open us an issue in our Github repository.

item.title: Secret Yaml
item.description: Secret-Yaml context stores an yaml file encrypted. Type .spec.type should be secret-yaml. Data .spec.data should be an array of keys and values. Examples secret-yaml with two keys apiVersion: "v1" kind: "context" owner: "account" metadata: name: "my-secret-yaml-context" spec: type: "secret-yaml" data: serviceType: "LoadBalancer" image: "mongo" type: - "encrypted"

item.title: Patch
item.description: Description Patch a resource from a file, directory or url Patch operation will apply only passed changes to an existing resource and will throw an error if the resource does not exist. Supported resources: ‘Context’. Command codefresh patch Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –filename - f Filename or directory of spec files use to create the resource

item.title: Set Active Context
Terminate Build
item.description: Description Terminate a build by its id. This command will return once the request has been received from the server. The termination process can take time according to the pipeline definition. Command codefresh terminate <id> Arguments Option Alias Default Description id Build id Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information Examples Terminate build ID codefresh terminate ID

item.title: Update Pipeline
Yaml
item.description: Description Create a yaml context. Command codefresh create context yaml <name> Arguments Option Alias Default Description name Name of context Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –owner account Owner of the context Possible values: - user - account –variable - v Variables list

item.title: Helm Repository
item.description: Helm-Repository context stores an integration with a helm repository. Type .spec.type should be helm-repository. Data .spec.data should be an array of keys and values. Examples

item.title: Annotate Image
Run Pipeline
item.description: Description Run a pipeline and attach the created workflow logs. Returns an exit code according to the workflow finish status (Success: 0, Error: 1, Terminated: 2). Command codefresh run <id> Arguments Option Alias Default Description id Pipeline id Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –branch - b Branch –sha - s Set commit sha –no-cache - n- c Ignore cached images –reset-volume - r- v Reset pipeline cached volume –variable - v Set build variables –detach - d Run pipeline and print build ID –context - c Run pipeline with contexts –variable-file - v- a- r- – f- i- l- e Set build variables from a file variable-file (var-file) It is possible to pass build variables using a file.

item.title: Wait For Build Condition
item.description: Description Wait until a condition will be met on a build. Wait command is useful in case there is a need to wait for a desired status on a specific set of builds. Command codefresh wait <id..> Arguments Option Alias Default Description id Build id Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –status - s success Build status.

item.title: HOMEBREW
item.description: Install Codefresh CLI on macOS with Homebrew. Install # tap Codefresh homebrew repo brew tap codefresh-io/cli # install Codefresh CLI brew install codefresh Update to the latest version brew upgrade codefresh Uninstall brew uninstall codefresh

item.title: Tag Image
item.description: Description Add an image tag. Tagging an image will result in the creation of a new Docker Image tag. Command codefresh tag <id> [tags..] Arguments Option Alias Default Description id Docker image id names Tag names Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information Examples Tag image ‘2dfacdaad466’ with a new tag: ‘1.

item.title: Image Pull Secret
item.description:
Description Generate image pull secret on Kubernetes cluster from integrated Docker registry.
For Kuberentes cluster to pull an image from your private registry it needs special secret typed as kubernetes.io/dockercfg. After this secret been created you can use them in pod template that lives in the same namespace. You can generate this secret from any integrated Docker registry on your account. More information about image pull secret can be found here: https://kubernetes.

item.title: Untag Image
item.description: Description Untag an image. Command codefresh untag <id> [tags..] Arguments Option Alias Default Description id Docker image id names Tag names Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information Examples Remove tag ‘1.0.0’ from image ‘2dfacdaad466’ codefresh untag 2dfacdaad466 1.0.0

item.title: Replace
item.description: Description Replace a resource from a file, directory or url Supported resources: ‘Context’ ‘Pipeline-v2’. Command codefresh replace Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information –filename - f Filename or directory of spec files use to create the resource

item.title: Replace Composition
item.description: Description Replace a composition resource. Command codefresh replace composition Aliases codefresh replace com composition Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information

item.title: Update Context
item.description: Description Apply changes to a context. Use apply to patch an existing context. Command codefresh patch context Aliases codefresh patch ctx context Options Option Alias Default Description –help Print help information Examples Apply changes to a context codefresh apply context -f ./context.yml

item.title: header
item.description: Codefresh CLI

item.title: External Resources
item.description: https://codefresh.io/blog/introducing-codefresh-cli/ by Dan Garfield

item.title: Spec
item.description: A Pipeline needs .apiVersion, .kind, and .metadata fields. A Pipeline also needs a .spec section. Examples Pipeline which is stored entirely in Codefresh apiVersion: "v1" kind: "pipeline" metadata: name: "new-pipeline" description: "my description" labels: repo: "ArikMaor/ping-server" key1: "value1" project: "asd" spec: triggers: - type: "scm" repo: "ArikMaor/ping-server" events: ["push", "pullrequest"] branchRegex: '.' contexts: [] variables: - key: "PORT" value: 3000 encrypted: false - key: "PAPA" value: "BLA BLA" encrypted: true steps: clone_step: repo: github.
